title: US school district apologises for using Winnie The Pooh in mass shootings safety book
description: A Dallas school district has apologised after distributing a Winnie The Pooh-themed book about school shootings.

title: Pope meets director Scorsese as pontiff resumes audiences after fever
description: Pope Francis has met film director Martin Scorsese as the pontiff resumed holding audiences after a bout of fever forced him to cancel engagements this week.

title: Shark bites off woman's leg in Caribbean
description: A 22-year-old woman has had her leg bitten off by a shark while snorkelling in the Caribbean.

title: 'Brutal' violence in Kosovo condemned as Serbia accuses NATO of inaction
description: Serbia has condemned NATO-led peacekeepers in neighbouring Kosovo for allegedly failing to stop "brutal actions" by Kosovo's police against ethnic Serbs.

title: Passenger arrested after plane door opened mid-flight explains he felt 'uncomfortable'
description: A passenger who was arrested after a plane door was opened on a domestic aircraft mid-flight has said he was "uncomfortable" and "wanted to get to get off the plane quickly", according to South Korean media.

title: Pink Floyd star says he was opposing 'fascism' when he wore Nazi-inspired uniform
description: Pink Floyd star Roger Waters says he was opposing "fascism, injustice and bigotry" when he posed firing an imitation machine gun while wearing a Nazi-inspired uniform at a concert in Berlin.

title: 'They set us on fire and took everything': Inside refugee camps as thousands flee Sudan
description: The 41-degree heat rises like steam from every rock and roof but as sunset approaches the sky breaks into a thunderstorm.

title: Crocodile farmer torn to pieces after falling into reptile enclosure
description: A crocodile farmer in Cambodia was ripped apart by around 40 of the reptiles after falling into their enclosure, according to police.

title: Papuan fighters threaten to shoot NZ pilot hostage without independence talks
description: Fighters in Indonesia's Papua region have threatened to shoot a New Zealand pilot they took hostage in February if independence talks are not launched.
